notes.text:
An update is now available for CloudForms Management Engine 5.10.

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Important. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
Red Hat CloudForms Management Engine delivers the insight, control, and automation needed to address the challenges of managing virtual environments. CloudForms Management Engine is built on Ruby on Rails, a model-view-controller (MVC) framework for web application development. Action Pack implements the controller and the view components.

Security Fix(es):

* rubygem-actionpack: render file directory traversal in Action View (CVE-2019-5418)

* rubygem-actionpack: denial of service vulnerability in Action View (CVE-2019-5419)

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.

Additional Changes:

This update fixes various bugs and adds enhancements. Documentation for these changes is available from the Release Notes document linked to in the References section.
notes.title: Details

cwe.name: Invocation of Process Using Visible Sensitive Information

notes.text: When running Tower on OpenShift or Kubernetes, application credentials are exposed to playbook job runs via environment variables. A malicious user with the ability to write playbooks could use this to gain administrative privileges.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: Tower: credentials leaked through environment variables
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

If the postgresql service is running, it will be automatically restarted after installing this update. After installing the updated packages, the httpd daemon will be restarted automatically.

vulnerabilities.title: Tower: credentials leaked through environment variables

cwe.name: Exposure of Sensitive Information to an Unauthorized Actor

notes.text: A content disclosure flaw was found in rubygem-actionview. Specially crafted accept headers, in combination with calls to 'render file:', can cause arbitrary files on the target server to be rendered, disclosing the file contents. Code execution cannot be ruled out if the attacker is able to gain access to the proper files. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to data confidentiality and integrity as well as system availability.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: rubygem-actionpack: render file directory traversal in Action View
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: This issue did affect the versions of rh-ror42-rubygem-actionpack and rh-ror50-rubygem-actionpack as shipped with Red Hat Software Collections.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.

vulnerabilities.title: rubygem-actionpack: render file directory traversal in Action View

notes.text: There is a possible denial of service vulnerability in Action View (Rails) <5.2.2.1, <5.1.6.2, <5.0.7.2, <4.2.11.1 where specially crafted accept headers can cause action view to consume 100% cpu and make the server unresponsive.
notes.title: Vulnerability description
